maml:description.maml:para: Add one or more entities to an Azure Table.
Add one or more entities to an Azure Table, provided as hashtables.
The connection string to the storage account.
The entities to add to the table.
Overwrites provided entities if they exist. The same as running the command Update-AzDataTableEntity.
The name of the table.
If the table should be created if it does not exist.
The entities to add to the table.
Overwrites provided entities if they exist. The same as running the command Update-AzDataTableEntity.
The table service SAS URL. The table endpoint of the storage account, with the shared access token appended to it.
The name of the table.
If the table should be created if it does not exist.
The entities to add to the table.
Overwrites provided entities if they exist. The same as running the command Update-AzDataTableEntity.
The storage account access key.
The name of the storage account.
The name of the table.
If the table should be created if it does not exist.
The entities to add to the table.
Overwrites provided entities if they exist. The same as running the command Update-AzDataTableEntity.
The name of the storage account.
The name of the table.
If the table should be created if it does not exist.
The token to use for authorization.
The entities to add to the table.
Overwrites provided entities if they exist. The same as running the command Update-AzDataTableEntity.
The name of the storage account.
The name of the table.
If the table should be created if it does not exist.
Specifies that the command is run by a managed identity (such as in an Azure Function), and authorization will be handled using that identity.
The connection string to the storage account.
The entities to add to the table.
Overwrites provided entities if they exist. The same as running the command Update-AzDataTableEntity.
The table service SAS URL. The table endpoint of the storage account, with the shared access token appended to it.
The storage account access key.
The name of the storage account.
The name of the table.
If the table should be created if it does not exist.
The token to use for authorization.
Specifies that the command is run by a managed identity (such as in an Azure Function), and authorization will be handled using that identity.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $User = @{ FirstName = 'Bobby'; LastName = 'Tables'; PartitionKey = 'Example'; RowKey = '1' } PS C:\> Add-AzDataTableEntity -Entity $User -TableName $TableName -SharedAccessSignature $SAS

dev:remarks.maml:para: Add the user "Bobby Tables" to a table using a shared access signature URL.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $Users = @( >> @{ FirstName = 'Bobby'; LastName = 'Tables'; PartitionKey = 'Example'; RowKey = '1' }, >> @{ FirstName = 'Bobby Junior'; LastName = 'Tables'; PartitionKey = 'Example'; RowKey = '2' } ) PS C:\> Add-AzDataTableEntity -Entity $Users -TableName $TableName -ConnectionString $ConnectionString -Force

dev:remarks.maml:para: Add multiple users to a table using a connection string, overwriting any existing rows.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Clear all entities from a table using a connection string.
Clear all entities from a table using a managed identity.

maml:description.maml:para: Get one or more entities from an Azure Table.
Get either all entities from an Azure Table, or those matching a provided OData filter.
Documentation on querying tables and entities: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-gb/rest/api/storageservices/querying-tables-and-entities
The connection string to the storage account.
If the table should be created if it does not exist.
The OData filter to use in the query. Documentation on querying tables and entities: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-gb/rest/api/storageservices/querying-tables-and-entities
One or several names of properties, to specify data to return for the entities.
The name of the table.
Gets only the specified number of objects. Enter the number of objects to get.
Ignores the specified number of objects and then gets the remaining objects. Enter the number of objects to skip.
Specifies one or several property names that to sort the entities by. If several properties are provided, the entities are sorted in the order that the property names are provided.
Note that using this parameter may slow down the command a lot when working with large data sets!
If the table should be created if it does not exist.
The OData filter to use in the query. Documentation on querying tables and entities: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-gb/rest/api/storageservices/querying-tables-and-entities
One or several names of properties, to specify data to return for the entities.
The table service SAS URL. The table endpoint of the storage account, with the shared access token token appended to it.
The name of the table.
Gets only the specified number of objects. Enter the number of objects to get.
Ignores the specified number of objects and then gets the remaining objects. Enter the number of objects to skip.
Specifies one or several property names that to sort the entities by. If several properties are provided, the entities are sorted in the order that the property names are provided.
Note that using this parameter may slow down the command a lot when working with large data sets!
If the table should be created if it does not exist.
The OData filter to use in the query. Documentation on querying tables and entities: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-gb/rest/api/storageservices/querying-tables-and-entities
One or several names of properties, to specify data to return for the entities.
The storage account access key.
The name of the storage account.
The name of the table.
Gets only the specified number of objects. Enter the number of objects to get.
Ignores the specified number of objects and then gets the remaining objects. Enter the number of objects to skip.
Specifies one or several property names that to sort the entities by. If several properties are provided, the entities are sorted in the order that the property names are provided.
Note that using this parameter may slow down the command a lot when working with large data sets!
If the table should be created if it does not exist.
The OData filter to use in the query. Documentation on querying tables and entities: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-gb/rest/api/storageservices/querying-tables-and-entities
One or several names of properties, to specify data to return for the entities.
The name of the storage account.
The name of the table.
The token to use for authorization.

Note that using this parameter may slow down the command a lot when working with large data sets!
If the table should be created if it does not exist.

One or several names of properties, to specify data to return for the entities.

Ignores the specified number of objects and then gets the remaining objects. Enter the number of objects to skip.
Specifies one or several property names that to sort the entities by. If several properties are provided, the entities are sorted in the order that the property names are provided.
Note that using this parameter may slow down the command a lot when working with large data sets!
The connection string to the storage account.
If the table should be created if it does not exist.

One or several names of properties, to specify data to return for the entities.
The table service SAS URL. The table endpoint of the storage account, with the shared access token token appended to it.

Specifies that the command is run by a managed identity (such as in an Azure Function), and authorization will be handled using that identity.
Ignores the specified number of objects and then gets the remaining objects. Enter the number of objects to skip.
Specifies one or several property names that to sort the entities by. If several properties are provided, the entities are sorted in the order that the property names are provided.
Note that using this parameter may slow down the command a lot when working with large data sets!

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $UserEntity = Get-AzDataTableEntity -Filter "FirstName eq 'Bobby' and LastName eq 'Tables'" -TableName $TableName -ConnectionString $ConnectionString

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the user "Bobby Tables" from the table using a connection string.
Skipping the first 100 entities, get 500 entities sorted by id and age from the table using a managed identity for authorization.
Get only the properties "FirstName" and "Age" for all entities found in the table using a shared access signature URL.

maml:description.maml:para: Remove one or more entities from an Azure Table.
Remove one or more entities from an Azure Table, based on PartitionKey and RowKey.
The connection string to the storage account.
The entities to remove from the table.
The name of the table.
If the table should be created if it does not exist.
The entities to remove from the table.
The table service SAS URL. The table endpoint of the storage account, with the shared access token token appended to it.
The name of the table.
If the table should be created if it does not exist.
The entities to remove from the table.
The storage account access key.
The name of the storage account.
The name of the table.
If the table should be created if it does not exist.
The entities to remove from the table.
The name of the storage account.
The name of the table.
If the table should be created if it does not exist.
The token to use for authorization.
The entities to remove from the table.
The name of the storage account.
The name of the table.
If the table should be created if it does not exist.
Specifies that the command is run by a managed identity (such as in an Azure Function), and authorization will be handled using that identity.
The connection string to the storage account.
The entities to remove from the table.
The table service SAS URL. The table endpoint of the storage account, with the shared access token token appended to it.
The storage account access key.
The name of the storage account.
The name of the table.
If the table should be created if it does not exist.
The token to use for authorization.
Specifies that the command is run by a managed identity (such as in an Azure Function), and authorization will be handled using that identity.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $Entity = @{ PartitionKey = 'Example'; RowKey = '1' } PS C:\> Remove-AzDataTableEntity -Entity $Entity -TableName $TableName -StorageAccountName $Name -StorageAccountKey $Key

dev:remarks.maml:para: Remove the entity with PartitionKey "Example" and RowKey "1", using the storage account name and an access key.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $UserEntity = Get-AzDataTableEntity -Filter "FirstName eq 'Bobby' and LastName eq 'Tables'" -TableName $TableName -ConnectionString $ConnectionString PS C:\> Remove-AzDataTableEntity -Entity $UserEntity -TableName $TableName -StorageAccountName $Name -StorageAccountKey $Key

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the user "Bobby Tables" from the table using a connection string, then remove the user using the storage account name and an access key.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $Users = Get-AzDataTableEntity -Filter "LastName eq 'Tables'" -TableName $TableName -ConnectionString $ConnectionString PS C:\> Remove-AzDataTableEntity -Entity $Users -TableName $TableName -StorageAccountName $Name -StorageAccountKey $Key

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets all users with the last name "Tables" from the table using a connection string, then removes the users using the storage account name and an access key.

maml:description.maml:para: Update one or more entities in an Azure Table.
Update one or more entities already existing in an Azure Table. For adding and overwriting, also see the command Add-AzDataTableEntity.
The PartitionKey and RowKey cannot be updated.
The connection string to the storage account.
The entities to update in the table.
The name of the table.
If the table should be created if it does not exist.
The entities to update in the table.
The table service SAS URL. The table endpoint of the storage account, with the shared access token token appended to it.
The name of the table.

The token to use for authorization.

The name of the storage account.
The name of the table.
If the table should be created if it does not exist.
Specifies that the command is run by a managed identity (such as in an Azure Function), and authorization will be handled using that identity.
The connection string to the storage account.
The entities to update in the table.
The table service SAS URL. The table endpoint of the storage account, with the shared access token token appended to it.
The storage account access key.
The name of the storage account.
The name of the table.
If the table should be created if it does not exist.
The token to use for authorization.
Specifies that the command is run by a managed identity (such as in an Azure Function), and authorization will be handled using that identity.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $UserEntity = Get-AzDataTableEntity -Filter "FirstName eq 'Bobby'" -TableName $TableName -ConnectionString $ConnectionString PS C:\> $UserEntity['LastName'] = 'Tables' PS C:\> Update-AzDataTableEntity -Entity $UserEntity -TableName $TableName -ConnectionString $ConnectionString

dev:remarks.maml:para: Update the last name of the user "Bobby" to "Tables" using a connection string.
